Digi

SOME DESCRIPTION HERE…

class dtpr.particles.digi.Digi(idigi, ev=None, wh=None, sc=None, st=None, sl=None, w=None, l=None, time=None, bx=None)[source]
BX
__init__(idigi, ev=None, wh=None, sc=None, st=None, sl=None, w=None, l=None, time=None, bx=None)[source]

Initialize a Digi instance.

You can either pass a root event entry from the ntuple or provide each attribute individually.

Parameters:

  • idigi (int) – The index of the digi.

  • ev – The root event object containing event data. If provided, other attributes are ignored.

  • wh (int, optional) – The wheel number.

  • sc (int, optional) – The sector number.

  • st (int, optional) – The station number.

  • sl (int, optional) – The superlayer number.

  • w (int, optional) – The wire number.

  • l (int, optional) – The layer number.

  • time (int, optional) – The time of the digi.

  • bx (int, optional) – The bunch crossing number.

__str__(indentLevel=0)[source]

Generate a string representation of the Digi instance.

Parameters:

indentLevel (int) – The indentation level for the summary.

Returns:

The digi summary.

Return type:

str

to_dict()[source]

Convert the Digi instance to a dictionary. Useful to use pandas.DataFrame’s.

Returns:

A dictionary representation of the Digi instance.
